Algeria – People's Democratic Republic of Algeria
Andorra – Principality of Andorra
country.moreInfo: Andorra is a co-principality in which the office of head of state is jointly held ex officio by the French president and the bishop of the Roman Catholic diocese of Urgell,[2] who himself is appointed by the Holy See.

country.name: Antigua and Barbuda
country.moreInfo: Antigua and Barbuda is a Commonwealth realm[e] with 1 autonomous region, Barbuda.[f]

country.name: Argentina – Argentine Republic[g]
country.moreInfo: Argentina is a federation of 23 provinces and 1 autonomous city.

country.name: Armenia – Republic of Armenia
country.moreInfo: Armenia is not recognised by Pakistan due to the dispute over Artsakh.[4][5][6]

country.name: Australia – Commonwealth of Australia
country.moreInfo: Australia is a Commonwealth realm[e] and a federation of six states and 10 territories. The external territories of Australia are: Ashmore and Cartier Islands Australian Antarctic Territory Christmas Island Cocos (Keeling) Islands Coral Sea Islands Territory Heard Island and McDonald Islands Norfolk Island

country.name: Austria – Republic of Austria
country.moreInfo: Member of the European Union.[c] Austria is a federation of nine states.

country.name: Azerbaijan – Republic of Azerbaijan
country.moreInfo: Azerbaijan contains one autonomous region, Nakhchivan [f] The de facto state of Artsakh has been established in the southwest of Azerbaijan.

country.name: Bahamas, The – Commonwealth of The Bahamas[8]
country.moreInfo: The Bahamas is a Commonwealth realm.[e]

country.name: Barbados
country.moreInfo: Barbados is a Commonwealth realm.[e]

country.name: Belgium – Kingdom of Belgium
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] Belgium is a federation divided into linguistic communities and regions.

country.name: Belize
country.moreInfo: Belize is a Commonwealth realm.[e]

country.name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
country.moreInfo: Bosnia and Herzegovina is a federation of two constituent units: Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina Republika Srpska and Brčko District, a self-governing administrative unit.[9]

country.name: Brazil – Federative Republic of Brazil
country.moreInfo: Brazil is a federation of 26 states and 1 federal district.

country.name: Brunei – Nation of Brunei, the Abode of Peace
Bulgaria – Republic of Bulgaria
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Canada[h]
country.moreInfo: Canada is a Commonwealth realm[e] and a federation of 10 provinces and 3 territories.

country.name: Cape Verde – Republic of Cabo Verde[i]
China – People's Republic of China[j]
country.sovereigntyDispute: Partially unrecognised. B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: China contains five autonomous regions, Guangxi, Inner Mongolia, Ningxia, Tibet, and Xinjiang.[f] Additionally, it has sovereignty over the Special Administrative Regions of: Hong Kong Macau China claims, but does not control Taiwan, which is governed by a rival administration (the Republic of China) that claims all of China as its territory.[k] China is not recognised by 17 UN member states and the Holy See, which, with the exception of Bhutan, all recognise Taiwan instead.[l]

country.name: Comoros – Union of the Comoros
country.moreInfo: Comoros is a federation of 3 islands.[m]

country.name: Costa Rica – Republic of Costa Rica
Croatia – Republic of Croatia
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Cyprus – Republic of Cyprus
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] The northeastern part of the island is the de facto state of Northern Cyprus. Cyprus is not recognised by Turkey due to the Cyprus dispute, with Turkey recognising Northern Cyprus.

country.name: Czech Republic[p]
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Democratic People's Republic of Korea → Korea, North
Democratic Republic of the Congo → Congo, Democratic Republic of the
Denmark – Kingdom of Denmark
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] The Kingdom of Denmark includes 2 self-governing territories: Faroe Islands Greenland The continental territory of Denmark, the Faroe Islands, and Greenland form the three constituent countries of the Kingdom.[q] The Kingdom of Denmark as a whole is a member of the EU, but EU law does not apply to the Faroe Islands and Greenland.[13][14]

country.name: East Timor – Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste[r]
El Salvador – Republic of El Salvador
Equatorial Guinea – Republic of Equatorial Guinea
Estonia – Republic of Estonia
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Ethiopia – Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia
country.moreInfo: Ethiopia is a federation of nine regions and two chartered cities.

country.name: Fiji – Republic of Fiji
country.moreInfo: Fiji contains 1 autonomous region, Rotuma.[f][15][16]

country.name: Finland – Republic of Finland
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] Åland is a neutral and demilitarised autonomous region of Finland.[f][t]

country.name: France – French Republic
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] France contains five overseas regions/departments: French Guiana, Guadeloupe, Martinique, Mayotte, and Réunion. France also includes the overseas territories of: Clipperton Island French Polynesia New Caledonia Saint Barthélemy Saint Martin Saint Pierre and Miquelon Wallis and Futuna French Southern and Antarctic Lands

country.name: Gambia Gambia, The – Republic of The Gambia[17]
Georgia
country.moreInfo: Georgia contains two autonomous republics, Adjara and Abkhazia.[f] In Abkhazia and South Ossetia, de facto states have been formed.

country.name: Germany – Federal Republic of Germany
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] Germany is a federation of 16 federated states.

country.name: Greece – Hellenic Republic
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] Greece contains one autonomous area, Mount Athos.[18]

country.name: Grenada
country.moreInfo: Grenada is a Commonwealth realm.[e]

country.name: Hungary
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: India – Republic of India
country.moreInfo: India is a federation of 29 states and seven union territories.

country.name: Indonesia – Republic of Indonesia
country.moreInfo: Indonesia has five autonomous provinces, Aceh, Jakarta, Papua, West Papua, and Yogyakarta.[f]

country.name: Iraq – Republic of Iraq
country.moreInfo: Iraq is a federation[m][22] of 19 governorates, five of which make up the autonomous Iraqi Kurdistan.[f]

country.name: Ireland[w]
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Israel – State of Israel
country.moreInfo: Israel exerts strong control over the territory claimed by Palestine. Israel annexed East Jerusalem,[24] an annexation not recognised by the international community.[25] Israel maintains varying levels of control over the rest of the West Bank, and although Israel no longer has a permanent civilian or military presence in the Gaza Strip, following its unilateral disengagement, it is still considered by some to be the occupying power under international law.[26][27][28][29][30] Israel is not recognised as a state by 32 UN members and the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic. The Palestine Liberation Organization, which enjoys majority recognition as sole representative of the Palestinian people, also does not recognise Israel.

country.name: Italy – Italian Republic
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] Italy has 5 autonomous regions, Aosta Valley, Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Sardinia, Sicily and Trentino-Alto Adige/Südtirol.[f]

country.name: Ivory Coast – Republic of Côte d'Ivoire[x]
Jamaica
country.moreInfo: Jamaica is a Commonwealth realm.[e]

country.name: Korea, North – Democratic People's Republic of Korea
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: North Korea is not recognised by three UN members, France, Japan, and South Korea, the last of which claims to be the sole legitimate government of Korea.[31]

country.name: Korea, South – Republic of Korea
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: South Korea has 1 autonomous region, Jejudo.[f][32] South Korea is not recognised by North Korea, which claims to be the sole legitimate government of Korea.

country.name: Latvia – Republic of Latvia
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Lithuania – Republic of Lithuania
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Luxembourg – Grand Duchy of Luxembourg
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Malaysia
country.moreInfo: Malaysia is a federation of 13 states and three federal territories.

country.name: Malta – Republic of Malta
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Marshall Islands – Republic of the Marshall Islands
country.moreInfo: Under Compact of Free Association with the United States.

country.name: Mauritius – Republic of Mauritius
country.moreInfo: Mauritius has an autonomous island, Rodrigues.[f]

country.name: Mexico – United Mexican States
country.moreInfo: Mexico is a federation of 31 states and one autonomous city.

country.name: Federated States of Micronesia
country.moreInfo: Under Compact of Free Association with the United States. The Federated States of Micronesia is a federation of four states.

country.name: Moldova – Republic of Moldova
country.moreInfo: Moldova has the autonomous regions of Gagauzia and Transnistria, the latter of which has established a de facto state.

country.name: Morocco – Kingdom of Morocco
country.moreInfo: Part of the Moroccan-claimed Western Sahara is controlled by the partially recognised Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic.

country.name: Myanmar – Republic of the Union of Myanmar[y]
Nepal – Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal
country.moreInfo: Nepal is a federation composed of 14 zones.

country.name: Netherlands – Kingdom of the Netherlands
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] The Kingdom of the Netherlands includes four areas with substantial autonomy: Aruba Curaçao Netherlands Sint Maarten The continental part of the Netherlands, Aruba, Curaçao, and Sint Maarten form the four constituent countries of the Kingdom. Three other territories (Bonaire, Saba, and Sint Eustatius) are special municipalities of the continental Netherlands.[z] The Kingdom of the Netherlands as a whole is a member of the EU, but EU law applies only to parts within Europe.

country.name: New Zealand
country.moreInfo: New Zealand is a Commonwealth realm,[e] and has the dependent territories of: Ross Dependency Tokelau New Zealand has responsibilities for (but no rights of control over) two freely associated states: Cook Islands Niue The Cook Islands and Niue have diplomatic relations with 49 and 18 UN members respectively.[33][34][35] They have full treaty-making capacity in the UN,[36] and are members of some UN specialized agencies.

country.name: Nicaragua – Republic of Nicaragua
country.moreInfo: Nicaragua contains two autonomous regions, Atlántico Sur and Atlántico Norte.[f]

country.name: Nigeria – Federal Republic of Nigeria
country.moreInfo: Nigeria is a federation of 36 states and 1 federal territory.

country.name: North Macedonia – Republic of North Macedonia[aa]
Norway – Kingdom of Norway
country.moreInfo: Svalbard is an integral part of Norway, but has a special status due to the Svalbard Treaty. Jan Mayen is an island that is an integral part of Norway, although unincorporated. Norway has the dependent territories of: Bouvet Island Peter I Island Queen Maud Land

country.name: Pakistan – Islamic Republic of Pakistan
country.moreInfo: Pakistan is a federation of four provinces and 1 capital territory. Pakistan exercises control over certain portions of Kashmir, but has not officially annexed any of it,[37][38] instead regarding it as a disputed territory.[39][40] The portions that it controls are divided into two territories, administered separately from Pakistan proper: Azad Kashmir Gilgit Baltistan Azad Kashmir describes itself as a "self-governing state under Pakistani control", while Gilgit-Baltistan is described in its governance order as a group of "areas" with self-government.[41][42][43] These territories are not usually regarded as sovereign, as they do not fulfill the criteria set out by the declarative theory of statehood (for example, their current laws do not allow them to engage independently in relations with other states). Several state functions of these territories (such as foreign affairs and defence) are performed by Pakistan.[42][44][45]

country.name: Palau – Republic of Palau
country.moreInfo: Under Compact of Free Association with the United States.

country.name: Palestine – State of Palestine
country.unMemberStatus: A UN observer state; member of 2 UN specialized agencies
country.sovereigntyDispute: Partially unrecognised. B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: The State of Palestine, declared in 1988, is not recognised as a state by Israel and has received diplomatic recognition from 137 states.[46] The proclaimed state has no agreed territorial borders, or effective control over much of the territory that it proclaimed.[47] The Palestinian National Authority is an interim administrative body formed as a result of the Oslo Accords that exercises limited autonomous jurisdiction within the Palestinian territories. In foreign relations, Palestine is represented by the Palestine Liberation Organization.[48] The State of Palestine is a member state of UNESCO,[49] UNIDO, and an observer state in the UN.

country.name: Papua New Guinea – Independent State of Papua New Guinea
country.moreInfo: Papua New Guinea is a Commonwealth realm[e] with 1 autonomous region, Bougainville.[f]

country.name: Philippines – Republic of the Philippines
country.moreInfo: The Philippines contains one autonomous region, Bangsamoro.[f]

country.name: Poland – Republic of Poland
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Portugal – Portuguese Republic
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] Portugal contains two autonomous regions, the Azores and Madeira.[f]

Romania
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Russia – Russian Federation
country.moreInfo: Russia is a federation of 85 federal subjects (republics, oblasts, krais, autonomous okrugs, federal cities, and an autonomous oblast). Several of the federal subjects are ethnic republics.[f]

country.name: ZZZSahrawi Arab Democratic Republic → Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic
Saint Kitts and Nevis – Federation of Saint Christopher and Nevis
country.moreInfo: Saint Kitts and Nevis is a Commonwealth realm[e] and is a federation[m] of two islands, St. Kitts and Nevis.

country.name: Saint Lucia
country.moreInfo: Saint Lucia is a Commonwealth realm.[e]

country.name: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
country.moreInfo: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines is a Commonwealth realm.[e]

country.name: San Marino – Republic of San Marino
São Tomé and Príncipe – Democratic Republic of São Tomé and Príncipe
country.moreInfo: São Tomé and Príncipe contains 1 autonomous province, Príncipe.[f]

country.name: Saudi Arabia – Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
Serbia – Republic of Serbia
country.moreInfo: Serbia contains two autonomous regions, Vojvodina and Kosovo and Metohija.[f] The latter is under the de facto control of the Republic of Kosovo.

country.name: Sierra Leone – Republic of Sierra Leone
Slovakia – Slovak Republic
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Slovenia – Republic of Slovenia
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Solomon Islands
country.moreInfo: The Solomon Islands is a Commonwealth realm.[e]

country.name: Somalia – Federal Republic of Somalia
country.moreInfo: Somalia has two self-declared autonomous regions, Puntland and Galmudug, while the territory of Somaliland has formed an unrecognised de facto state.

country.name: South Africa – Republic of South Africa
South Sudan – Republic of South Sudan
country.moreInfo: South Sudan is a federation of 32 states. The Abyei Area is a zone with "special administrative status" established by the Comprehensive Peace Agreement in 2005. It is de-jure a condominium of South Sudan and Sudan, but de facto administered by two competeing administrations and the United Nations.[50][51]

country.name: Spain – Kingdom of Spain
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] Spain is divided into 17 autonomous communities and 2 special autonomous cities.[f]

country.name: Sri Lanka – Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka[ab]
Sudan – Republic of the Sudan
country.moreInfo: Sudan is a federation of 18 states. The Abyei Area is a zone with "special administrative status" established by the Comprehensive Peace Agreement in 2005. It is de-jure a condominium of South Sudan and Sudan, but de facto administered by two competeing administrations and the United Nations.[50][51]

country.name: Sweden – Kingdom of Sweden
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c]

country.name: Switzerland – Swiss Confederation
country.moreInfo: Switzerland is a federation of 26 cantons.

country.name: Syria – Syrian Arab Republic
country.moreInfo: The Syrian National Coalition, which is recognised as the legitimate representative of the Syrian people by 20 UN members, has established an interim government to rule rebel controlled territory during the Syrian civil war. Syria has one self-declared autonomous region: Rojava.

country.name: Tajikistan – Republic of Tajikistan
country.moreInfo: Tajikistan contains 1 autonomous region, Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Province.[f]

country.name: Tanzania – United Republic of Tanzania
country.moreInfo: Tanzania contains 1 autonomous region, Zanzibar.[f]

country.name: Trinidad and Tobago – Republic of Trinidad and Tobago
country.moreInfo: Trinidad and Tobago contains 1 autonomous region, Tobago.[f]

country.name: Tuvalu
country.moreInfo: Tuvalu is a Commonwealth realm.[e]

country.name: Ukraine
country.moreInfo: Ukraine claims Crimea as an autonomous republic, however it has been annexed by Russia.

country.name: United Arab Emirates
country.moreInfo: The United Arab Emirates is a federation of seven emirates.

country.name: United Kingdom – United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
country.moreInfo: Member of the EU.[c] The United Kingdom is a Commonwealth realm[e] consisting of four constituent countries: England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, and Wales. The United Kingdom has the following overseas territories: Akrotiri and Dhekelia Anguilla Bermuda British Indian Ocean Territory British Virgin Islands Cayman Islands Falkland Islands Gibraltar Montserrat Pitcairn Islands Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands Turks and Caicos Islands British Antarctic Territory The British monarch has direct sovereignty over three self-governing Crown dependencies: Guernsey Isle of Man Jersey

country.name: United States – United States of America
country.moreInfo: The United States is a federation of 50 states with shared sovereignty, 1 federal district, and 1 incorporated territory. Additionally, the Federal government of the United States has sovereignty over 15 unincorporated territories. Of these territories the following are inhabited possessions: American Samoa Guam Northern Mariana Islands Puerto Rico U.S. Virgin Islands It also has sovereignty over several uninhabited territories: Baker Island Howland Island Jarvis Island Johnston Atoll Kingman Reef Midway Atoll Navassa Island Wake Island It also disputes sovereignty over the following territories: Bajo Nuevo Bank Serranilla Bank Three sovereign states have become associated states of the United States under the Compact of Free Association: Marshall Islands – Republic of the Marshall Islands Micronesia – Federated States of Micronesia Palau – Republic of Palau

country.name: Uzbekistan – Republic of Uzbekistan
country.moreInfo: Uzbekistan contains 1 autonomous region, Karakalpakstan.[f]

country.name: Vatican City – Vatican City State
country.unMemberStatus: A UN observer state under the designation of "Holy See"; member of three UN specialized agencies and the IAEA
country.moreInfo: Administered by the Holy See, a sovereign entity with diplomatic relations to 183 states. This figure consists of 180 UN member states, the Cook Islands, the Republic of China (Taiwan), and the State of Palestine.[52] In addition, the European Union and the Sovereign Military Order of Malta maintain diplomatic relations with the Holy See. The Holy See is a member of the IAEA, ITU, UPU, and WIPO and a permanent observer of the UN (in the category of "Non-member State")[48] and multiple other UN System organizations. The Vatican City is governed by officials appointed by the Pope, who is the Bishop of the Diocese of Rome and ex officio sovereign of Vatican City.

country.name: Venezuela – Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela
country.moreInfo: Venezuela is a federation of 23 states, 1 capital district, and federal dependencies.

country.name: ZZZ↑ UN member states and observer states ↑
Abkhazia – Republic of Abkhazia
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: Recognised by Russia, Nauru, Nicaragua, Venezuela, Artsakh, South Ossetia and Transnistria.[53] Claimed in whole by Georgia as the Autonomous Republic of Abkhazia.

country.name: Artsakh – Republic of Artsakh[ac]
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: A de facto independent state,[54][55][56] recognised only by Abkhazia,[57] South Ossetia[57] and Transnistria.[57][58] Claimed in whole by Azerbaijan.[59]

country.name: Cook Islands
country.unMemberStatus: D Member of eight UN specialized agencies
country.moreInfo: A state in free association with New Zealand, the Cook Islands maintains diplomatic relations with 52 states. The Cook Islands is a member of multiple UN agencies with full treaty making capacity.[36] It shares a head of state with New Zealand as well as having shared citizenship.

country.name: Kosovo – Republic of Kosovo
country.unMemberStatus: D Member of two UN specialized agencies
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: Pursuant to United Nations Security Council Resolution 1244, Kosovo was placed under the administration of the United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo in 1999.[60] Kosovo declared independence in 2008, and it has received diplomatic recognition from 102 UN member states and the Republic of China. Serbia continues to maintain its sovereignty claim over Kosovo. Other UN member states and non UN member states continue to recognise Serbian sovereignty or have taken no position on the question. Kosovo is a member of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank Group. The Republic of Kosovo has de facto control over most of the territory, with limited control in North Kosovo.

country.name: Niue
country.unMemberStatus: D Member of five UN specialized agencies
country.moreInfo: A state in free association with New Zealand, Niue maintains diplomatic relations with 20 states. Niue is a member of multiple UN agencies with full treaty making capacity.[36] It shares a head of state with New Zealand as well as having shared citizenship.

country.name: Northern Cyprus – Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: Recognised only by Turkey. Under the name "Turkish Cypriot State", it is an observer state of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation and the Economic Cooperation Organization. Northern Cyprus is claimed in whole by the Republic of Cyprus.[61]

country.name: Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: Recognised at some stage by 84 UN member states, 40 of which have since withdrawn or frozen their recognition. It is a founding member of the African Union and the Asian–African Strategic Partnership formed at the 2005 Asian–African Conference. The territories under its control, the so-called Free Zone, are claimed in whole by Morocco as part of its Southern Provinces. In turn, the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic claims the part of Western Sahara to the west of the Moroccan Wall controlled by Morocco. Its government resides in exile in Tindouf, Algeria.

country.name: Somaliland – Republic of Somaliland
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: A de facto independent state,[54][62][63][64][65] not diplomatically recognised by any other state, claimed in whole by the Federal Republic of Somalia.[66]

country.name: South Ossetia – Republic of South Ossetia–the State of Alania
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: A de facto independent state,[67] recognised by Russia, Nicaragua, Nauru, Syria, Venezuela, Abkhazia, Artsakh and Transnistria. Claimed in whole by Georgia as the Provisional Administrative Entity of South Ossetia.[68]

country.name: Taiwan – Republic of China[j]
country.unMemberStatus: DFormer UN member (as Republic of China, 1945–1971) Observer in one UN specialized agency under the name "Chinese Taipei"
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: A state competing (nominally) for recognition with the People's Republic of China (PRC) as the government of China since 1949. The Republic of China (ROC) controls the island of Taiwan and associated islands, Quemoy, Matsu, the Pratas and parts of the Spratly Islands, and has not renounced claims over its annexed territories on the mainland.[69] The ROC is recognised by 16 UN member states and the Holy See as of 21 August 2018. All these states do not recognise the PRC either. Additionally, one UN member (Bhutan) has refrained from recognising either the ROC or the PRC. The territory of the ROC is claimed in whole by the PRC.[k] The ROC participates in international organizations under a variety of pseudonyms, most commonly "Chinese Taipei" and in the WTO it has full membership. The ROC was a founding member of the UN and enjoyed membership from 1945 to 1971, with veto power in the UN Security Council. See China and the United Nations.

country.name: Transnistria – Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic
country.sovereigntyDispute: B Claimed by Georgia Claimed by North Korea Claimed by Serbia Claimed by Somalia Claimed by the People's Republic of China Claimed by the Republic of China Claimed by South Korea Claimed by Azerbaijan Claimed by the Republic of Cyprus Disputed by Israel Claimed by Mauritius Claimed by Morocco Claimed by Moldova Claimed by Mali Claimed by Spain
country.moreInfo: A de facto independent state,[54] recognised only by Abkhazia, Artsakh and South Ossetia.[53] Claimed in whole by Moldova as the Transnistria autonomous territorial unit.[70]
